entities.author: Oxford Centre for Functional MRI of the Brain (FMRIB)
entities.description: A wrapper for FSL sub. Assumes that task will run on a file system shared with the submission process, that input files are already in place, and that output files will be handled by another process.
entities.label: fsl_sub

entities.author: Oxford Centre for Functional MRI of the Brain (FMRIB)
entities.description: General pipeline for processing anatomical images (e.g. T1-weighted scans) via FSL tools. The stages include reorienting the images to the standard (MNI) orientation [fslreorient2std], automatically cropping the image [robustfov], bias-field correction (RF/B1-inhomogeneity-correction) [FAST], registration to standard space (linear and non-linear) [FLIRT and FNIRT], brain-extraction [FNIRT-based or BET], tissue-type segmentation [FAST], and subcortical structure segmentation [FIRST]
entities.label: fsl_anat

entities.author: Oxford Centre for Functional MRI of the Brain (FMRIB)
entities.description: ICA-AROMA (i.e. Independent Component Analyis-based Automatic Removal Of Motion Artifacts) is a data-driven method to identify and remove motion-related independent components from fMRI data.
entities.label: ICA_AROMA

entities.author: Oxford Centre for Functional MRI of the Brain (FMRIB)
entities.description: Automated brain extraction tool for FSL
entities.label: fsl_bet

entities.author: Oxford Centre for Functional MRI of the Brain (FMRIB)
entities.description: FIRST is a model-based segmentation and registration tool, based on a Bayesian model of shape and appearance for subcortical structures.
entities.label: fsl_first

entities.author: McConnell Brain Imaging Centre, Montreal
entities.description: Automated brain extraction tool wrapper for the MINC libraries
entities.label: MINCBet

entities.author: Oxford Centre for Functional MRI of the Brain (FMRIB)
entities.description: FAST (FMRIB's Automated Segmentation Tool) segments a 3D image of the brain into different tissue types (Grey Matter, White Matter, CSF, etc.), whilst also correcting for spatial intensity variations (also known as bias field or RF inhomogeneities), via a hidden Markov random field model and an associated EM algorithm. Note that the alternative priors option is not supported at this time.
entities.label: fsl_fast
